question:
Which of the following statements is / are correct regarding India’s first electronic surveillance satellite EMISAT?
  1. It is an advanced electronic intelligence (ELINT) satellite jointly developed by ISRO and DRDO
  2. It is modelled after a famous Israeli spy satellite called SARAL
  3. The electronic surveillance payload of EMISAT was developed under a DRDO project called ‘Kautilya’
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
Statement (1) is correct: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has launched the country’s first electronic surveillance satellite, EMISAT. It was launched on-board PSLV-C45. As many as 28 small satellites of international customers were also put in space as secondary riders. It is an advanced electronic intelligence (ELINT) satellite jointly developed by ISRO-DRDO. It is meant for electromagnetic spectrum measurements.
Statement (2) is correct: It is modeled after a famous Israeli spy satellite called SARAL (Satellite with ARgos and ALtika).
Statement (3) is correct: EMISAT has been developed under DRDO\'s Project “Kautilya” which aims to boost India\'s space surveillance capacity.
